com.att.research.xacml.std.datatypes

Class IPAddress

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.att.research.xacml.std.datatypes.IPAddress
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SemanticString
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    IPv4Address, IPv6Address

    public abstract class IPAddress
extends java.lang.Object
implements SemanticString
    IPAddress represents either an IPv4 or IPv6 network address with optional (IPv4)masks or (IPv6)prefixes and port range components.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.1 $
    Author:
    car

        public static IPAddress newInstance(java.lang.String ipAddressString)
                             throws java.text.ParseException
        Given a string purporting to represent an IPAddress, try to convert it into an object. The string may represent either an IPv4Address or an IPv6Address, and may include a mask (for IPv4) or a prefix (for IPv6) and may also include a PortRange
